Why do I need a neuroradiologist to interpret my spine MRI images? What is Piriformis Syndrome?

April 12, 2020

Is your spine MRI interpretation accurate? Learn why a neuroradiologist is key for Piriformis Syndrome & nerve pain diagnosis.

This is one of our published cases that illustrates the necessity of a neuroradiology expert when dealing with neuroimaging and neurological symptoms. This patient was going for a lumbar spine surgery based on minor abnormalities on her lumbar spine MRI and right sided radiculopathy in S1 nerve distribution. A sacral plexus MRI was then obtained witch showed the cause of her symptoms.

See Our publication describing the details of this case by clicking here

Next step: Need a second opinion or advanced neuroimaging interpretation? Explore Clinical neuroradiology consulting or contact us for a consultation.
